intro: Pentasacme shanense, commonly known as the Shan pentasacme, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
